description: Retrospective application for a suka roof and an additional 0.13m ground floor extension
decision_conditions: <p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 10pt;"><span style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-size: 14px;">ï»¿</span><span style="background-color: transparent; text-align: justify; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">A drainage layout of at least one suitable sustainable drainage system (i.e. water butt, rain garden, bio-retention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150 mm excluding the vegetative mat), </span><span style="text-align: justify; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; font-size: 14px;">permeable</span><span style="background-color: transparent; text-align: justify; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;"> paving, etc.) shall be submitted to the LPA for approval, in consultation with the LLFA </span><span style="background-color: transparent; text-align: justify; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">by the 17 April 2024.</span><span style="background-color: transparent; text-align: justify; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;"> If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume. The development shall be constructed and retained as per the approved drawings.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span id="docs-internal-guid-27f97469-7fff-b42a-c992-fa83102fcb04" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"></span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-c980cb5c-7fff-8c1c-a789-3c0853b1719a"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">REASON: </span><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:#ffffff;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">To protect and where possible enhance biodiversity leading to a net gain.</span></p>
